title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A novel set in the Jazz Age on Long Island, near New York City in 1922.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A gripping, heart-wrenching, and wholly remarkable tale of coming-of-age in a South poisoned by virulent prejudice.

author: George Orwell
description: Orwell's novel about a dystopian future where critical thought is suppressed under a totalitarian regime.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A novel of manners that offers a satirical view of the British upper class in the early 19th century.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: The story of Holden Caulfield, a teenage boy who becomes disillusioned with the adult world.

title: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: An epic tale of obsession and revenge, following the journey of the whaling ship Pequod.

title: The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn
author: Mark Twain
description: The tale of young Huckleberry Finn and his journey down the Mississippi River.

title: Wuthering Heights
author: Emily Brontë
description: A dark and passionate tale of love and revenge on the Yorkshire moors.

title: Great Expectations
author: Charles Dickens
description: The story of Pip, an orphan whose life is changed by a series of extraordinary events.

title: Jane Eyre
author: Charlotte Brontë
description: A novel that explores themes of morality, religion, and feminism through the life of Jane Eyre.
